__data__.text:
E n d p o i n t s
/ u p l o a d _ f i l e
●
Method:
POST
●
URL
Params:
None
●
Data
Params:
●
file:
The
file
to
be
uploaded
(PDF
format).
●
course_name:
The
name
of
the
course
associated
with
the
uploaded
file.
●
course_settings:
The
settings
for
the
course
in
JSON
format.
●
Success
Response:
●
Code:
200
●
Content:
"Index
created
for
{course_name}"
●
Error
Response:
●
Code:
400
●
Content:
"Missing
file."
or
"Empty
filename."
or
"Missing
course
settings."
●
Code:
500
●
Content:
{error:
str(e)}
●
Description:
This
endpoint
allows
users
to
upload
a
PDF
file
related
to
a
course.
The
file
is
saved
in
a
dedicated
directory
with
a
unique
name.
Additionally,
the
endpoint
processes
course
settings
and
creates
an
index
for
the
course.
Sample
Request
(curl)
curl
-i
-X
POST
\
-H
"Content-Type:multipart/form-data"
\

-F
"file=@\"./Pages
from
BCBF_English
(1).pdf\";type=application/pdf;filename=\"Pages
from
BCBF_English
(1).pdf\""
\
-F
"course_name=PagesBCBFtest"
\
-F
"course_settings=\"{\\"NoOfTopics\\":
3,
\\"NoOfSubTopicsPerTopic\\":
2,
\\"NoOfBulletsPerSubTopic\\":
4,
\\"NoOfWordsPerBullet\\":
10,
\\"NoOfWordsForVOPerBullet\\":
20,
\\"NoOfWordsPerTopicSummary\\":
10,
\\"NoOfWordsForVOPerTopicSummary\\":
20}\""
\
'http://18.142.129.190/upload_file'
Sample
Response

/ g e t _ t o p i c s
●
Method:
POST
●
URL
Params:
None
●
Data
Params:
●
course_name:
The
name
of
the
course
for
which
topics
are
requested.
●
Success
Response:
●
Code:
200
●
Content:
{
course_data
}
●
Error
Response:
●
Code:
400
●
Content:
"Missing
course_name."
or
"Missing
course_settings.json
file."
●
Code:
500
●
Content:
{
"error":
str(e)
}
●
Description:
This
endpoint
retrieves
the
topics
for
a
specified
course.
It
generates
topics
based
on
the
provided
course
settings
and
returns
the
course
data
in
JSON
format.
Sample
Request
(curl)
curl
-i
-X
POST
\
-H
"Content-Type:application/json"
\
-d
\
'
{"course_name":
"PagesBCBFtest"}'
\
'http://18.142.129.190/get_topics'
Sample
Response
{
"course_name":
"PagesBCBFtest",
"learning_objectives":
[
],
"topics":
[
{
"topic_name":
"Understand
the
need
of
a
bank
and
its
various
functions\n"
},
{
"topic_name":
"Learn
about
the
various
types
of
banks
in
India
and
their
recent
trends\n"
},
{
"topic_name":
"Explore
the
different
banking
services
available
and
their
benefits"

}
]
}
/ s a v e T o p i c s
●
Method:
POST
●
URL
Params:
None
●
Data
Params:
●
course_name:
The
name
of
the
course.
●
topics:
A
list
of
topic
names.
●
Success
Response:
●
Code:
200
●
Content:
{
course_data
}
●
Error
Response:
●
Code:
400
●
Content:
"Missing
course_name."
or
"Missing
topics."
or
"Missing
course_settings.json
file."
or
"NoOfSubTopicsPerTopic
not
found
in
course
settings."
●
Code:
500
●
Content:
{
"error":
str(e)
}
●
Description:
This
endpoint
takes
a
list
of
topics
and
generates
a
specified
number
of
subtopics
for
each
topic.
It
then
saves
the
updated
topics
list
(with
subtopics)
to
a
JSON
file.

Sample
Request
(curl)
curl
-i
-X
POST
\
-H
"Content-Type:application/json"
\
-d
\
'{
"course_name":
"PagesBCBFtest",
"learning_objectives":
[
],
"topics":
[
{
"topic_name":
"Understand
the
need
of
a
bank
and
its
various
functions\n"
},
{

"topic_name":
"Learn
about
the
various
types
of
banks
in
India
and
their
recent
trends\n"
},
{
"topic_name":
"Explore
the
different
banking
services
available
and
their
benefits"
}
]
}
'
\
'http://18.142.129.190/saveTopics'

Response

str(e)
}
●
Description:
This
endpoint
generates
summaries
and
voiceover
scripts
for
each
topic.
It
then
saves
the
updated
course
data
(including
these
summaries
and
scripts)
to
a
JSON
file.
Sample
Request
(curl)
curl
-i
-X
POST
\
-H
"Content-Type:application/json"
\
-d
\
'{
"course_name":
"PagesBCBFtest",

"learning_objectives":
[
],
"topics":
[
{
"subtopics":
[
],

the
need
of
a
bank
and
its
various
functions\n"
},
{
"subtopics":
[
{

"Need
of
a
Bank\n"
},
{
"subtopic_name":
"Various
Types
of
Banks
in
India"
}
],
"topic_name":
"Learn
about
the
various
types
of
banks
in
India
and
their
recent
trends\n"
},
{
"subtopics":
[
{

"Need
of
Banking
Services\n"
},

in
Banking"
}
],

the
different
banking
services

and
their
benefits"
}
]
}
'

"subtopic_voiceover_script":
{
"Bullet
1
Voiceover
Script":
"\n\"Access
to
financial
services
is
now
easier
than
ever.
With
the
introduction
of
the
Pradhan
Mantri
Jan
Dhan
Yojana,
Pradhan
Mantri
Jeevan
Jyoti
Scheme,
and
Pradhan
Mantri
Suraksha
Bima
Yojana,
banking
services
are
now
available
to
everyone,
no
matter
where
they
are.
Technology
has
made
it
possible
to
access
banking
services
anytime,
anywhere.
With
the
help
of
Business
Correspondents
and
Business
Facilitators,
banking
services
are
now
available
in
even
the
remotest
areas.
Get
access
to
financial
services
today!\"",
"Bullet
2
Voiceover
Script":
"\nBanks
provide
savings
and
remittance
services
to
help
customers
securely
store
and
transfer
money.
With
banks,
customers
can
easily
and

quickly transfer funds from one place to another, making it a convenient and cost-effective way to manage finances.", "Bullet 3 Voiceover Script": "
Banks offer a range of credit and ancillary products to meet the needs of customers. These include cash credits, overdrafts, demand loans, term loans, corporate loans, SME advances, agricultural loans, retail loans, foreign currency loans, educational loans, vehicle loans and more.", "Bullet 4 Voiceover Script": "
Insurance and risk management are important services that banks provide to their customers. Banks offer insurance products and services to help protect customers from financial losses and manage risks. Banks also provide advisory services to help customers make informed decisions about their finances." } }, { "subtopic_bullets": [ "", "1. Public Sector Banks: State-owned banks providing banking services to the public.", "2. Nationalized Banks: Banks taken over by the government to provide banking services.", "3. Private Banks: Banks owned by individuals or companies providing banking services.", "4. Foreign Banks: Banks from other countries providing banking services in India." ], "subtopic_name": "Various Types of Banks in India", "subtopic_voiceover_script": { "Bullet 1 Voiceover Script": "
Increased Use of Technology

Voice-over Script: Technology is revolutionizing banking operations, enabling off-site banking, payment of utilities, travel reservations, and more. Core Banking Solution has enabled anywhere, anytime banking. Mobile banking is becoming increasingly popular. Funds can be transferred quickly and securely through RTGS and NEFT. Banks are also offering "wallet" banking services. Plastic money such as credit and debit cards are becoming commonplace.", "Bullet 2 Voiceover Script": "
Public sector banks are state-owned banks providing banking services to the public. They are characterized by majority ownership by the Government of India and offer a variety of services such as SBI Life Insurance, SBI Mutual Funds, SBI Factors, SBI Capital Markets, and SBI Cards.", "Bullet 3 Voiceover Script": "
Nationalized Banks are banks taken over by the government to provide banking services. They have the largest number of branches in metro, urban, semi-urban and rural areas across the country.", "Bullet 4 Voiceover Script": "
Private banks are owned by individuals or companies and provide banking services. They offer a variety of services such as deposits, loans, investments, and remittances. They are known for their competitive rates and customer service. Private banks are a great option for those looking for a reliable and secure banking experience.",

"Bullet
5
Voiceover
Script":
"\nForeign
banks
provide
banking
services
in
India,
offering
a
wide
range
of
services
such
as
corporate
banking,
foreign
exchange,
export/import
finance,
and
merchant
banking.
They
offer
customers
access
to
global
financial
markets
and
products."
}
}
],
